title: Power - new power when resistance is doubled

content.question: A resistor of resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> is connected to a battery in a closed circuit, and the total power dissipated in the resistor is <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math>. The resistor is then replaced with one of resistance <math alttext="2 R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math>. What is the power dissipated in the new resistor?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
